name: Magis Networks
overview:
As of February 2006, Magis Networks, Inc. went out of business. Magis Networks, Inc. operates as a fabless semiconductor company in California. It produces the Air5 wireless chipsets that comprise the MGS6228 RF chips and the MGS6218 broadband chips. The company allows manufacturers to use Air5 chipsets to provide wireless home entertainment networking; and throughput between broadband network devices and consumer electronics products, as well as home computing platforms. It also offers end-to-end customer support to assist manufacturers and developers with their Air5 product development efforts. The companyâ€™s device applications include set-top boxes, gateways, satellite receivers, cable modems, standard and HDTV televisions, flat panels, laptops, smart displays, DVDs, and gaming consoles. It serves cable, video, and multimedia customers.

The company was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in San Diego, California.
